1.q_string: A source and an observer are approaching each other with \(50 ms ^{-1}\) velocity. What will be its original frequency if the observer receives \(400\) cycles/s? Take speed of sound \(=340 m / s\)
A ball of mass \(2 Kg\) moving with velocity \(3 ms ^{-1}\), collides with spring of natural length \(2 m\) and force constant \(144 Nm ^{-1}\). What will be the length of the compressed spring?

A particle in SHM is described by the displacement equation \(x(t)=A\) \(\cos (\omega t+\theta)\). If the initial \((t=0)\) position of the particle is \(1 cm\) and its initial velocity is \(\pi cm / s\), then what is its amplitude? (The angular frequency of the particle is \(\pi s^{-1}\).)
The angular amplitude of a simple pendulum is \(\theta_{0}\). What will be the maximum tension in its string?

The time period of a particle in simple harmonic motion is \(8\) seconds. At \(t=0\), it is at the mean position. The ratio of the distances travelled by it in the \(1^{\text {st }}\) second and the \(2^{\text {nd }}\) second is:
A particle is executing two different simple harmonic motions mutually perpendicular to different amplitudes and having a phase difference of \(\frac{\pi}{2}\). The path of the particle will be:

A particle executes linear simple harmonic motion with amplitude of \(2 cm\). When the particle is at \(1 cm\) from the mean position, the magnitude of its velocity is equal to that of its acceleration. Its time period (in seconds) is:
A particle starts SHM from a mean position. Its amplitude is '\(a\)' and total energy is \(E\). At one instant, its kinetic energy is \(\frac{3 E }{ 4}\). Its displacement at that instant is:

Two identical springs are connected in series and parallel as shown in the figure. If \(f_{s}\) and \(f_{p}\) are frequencies of series and parallel arrangements, respectively, then what is \(\frac{f_{s}}{f_{p}}\) ?

The time period of a simple pendulum of length \(1\) is \(T_{1}\) and time period of a uniform rod of the same length \(L\) pivoted about one end and oscillating in a vertical plane is \(T _{2}\).Amplitude of oscillations in both the cases is small. Then \(\frac{T _{1} }{ T _{2}}\) is:

A simple pendulum with bob of mass \(m\) and conducting wire of length \(L\) swings under gravity through an angle \(2 \theta\). The earth's magnetic field component in the direction perpendicular to swing is B.The maximum potential difference induced across the pendulum is:

A simple pendulum is released from \(A\), as shown in the figure. If \(m\) and \(l\) represent the mass of the bob and the length of the pendulum, respectively, then the gain in kinetic energy at \(B\) is:
The equation of a simple harmonic wave is given by \(y=5 \sin \frac{\pi}{2}(100 t-x)\), where \(x\) and \(y\) are in metres and \(t\) is in seconds. The period of the wave will be

A uniform wire of linear density \(0.004 kgm ^{-1}\) when stretched between two rigid supports with a tension \(3.6 \times 10^{2} N\), resonates with a frequency of \(420 Hz\). The next harmonic frequency with which the wire resonates is \(490 Hz\). The length of the wire in metres is:

The frequency of a tuning fork is \(256 Hz\). The velocity of sound in air is \(344 ms ^{-1}\). The distance travelled (in metres) by the sound during the time in which the tuning fork completes \(32\) vibrations is:

What is the beat frequency produced when the following two waves are sounded together?

\(x_{1}=10 \sin (404 \pi t-5 \pi x), x_{2}=10 \sin (400 \pi t-5 \pi x)\)

A point mass \(m\) is suspended at the end of a massless wire of length \(L\) and cross section \(A\). If \(Y\) is Young's modulus for the wire, what will be the frequency of oscillation for the SHM along the vertical line?
The factor determining the pitch of a tuning fork is
When both the listener and the source are moving towards each other, then which of the following is true regarding the frequency and wavelength of the wave observed by the observer?
The first overtone of a stretched wire of given length is \(320 Hz\). The first harmonic is:
The pendulum of a wall clock executes:

q_option: A zig zag motion about a straight line
Combination of translational motion and rotational motion
1.q_string: Oscillatory motion is best described by:

q_option: Motion in which object comes to mean position at random intervals of time
Motion that does not repeat itself at regular intervals of time
Motion that repeats itself at regular intervals of time
Motion that repeats itself at irregular intervals of time
1.q_string: How can you describe a periodic motion?
Period of a periodic motion is the ________ interval of time after which the motion is __________.

q_option: the reciprocal of the period of oscillation
1.q_string: Frequency of the periodic motion is:
